actions.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Social Security.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Ways and Means

official_title: A bill to provide that certain administration expenses incurred in carrying out the Social Security Act will be paid from general revenue funds rather than from the trust funds established in title II and part A of title XVIII of the Social Security Act.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Amends title VII (Administration) of the Social Security Act to authorize appropriations for each fiscal year for the payment of specified administrative expenses, including administrative expenses incurred in conducting demonstration or pilot projects, experiments, and studies under titles II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance), XVI (Supplemental Security Income), and XVIII (Medicare) and incurred with respect to specified tax provisions (currently such expenses are paid out of the Federal Old-Age and Survivors Insurance Trust Fund, the Federal Disability Insurance Trust Fund, and the Federal Hospital Insurance Trust Fund).

titles.title: A bill to provide that certain administration expenses incurred in carrying out the Social Security Act will be paid from general revenue funds rather than from the trust funds established in title II and part A of title XVIII of the Social Security Act.
